communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide records sufficient to determine the number of voluntary employee union recognitions from July 1, 2024 through September 30, 2024. If available, please provide records about individual recognition with such fields as employer, location, description of bargaining unit, union, and size of unit, and any other non-exempt fields on Form NLRB-5581.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Forest Gregg

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Emails with subject lines beginning with the exact phrase "PDR Review" sent and received by the Mayor's Office since January 1, 2024, including attachments and associated metadata. Please only provide one copy of emails sent/received by multiple people in the Mayor's Office.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

title: Contract with Nicholas Joseph LaLota (Nick LaLota)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All contracts, agreements, memorandums of understanding (MOUs) and other equivalent agreements that are currently active, or have been active since Jan. 1, 2022 to the date this request is ultimately fulfilled between the Suffolk County Legislature Nicholas Joseph LaLota (Nick LaLota). This includes all contract extensions, contract amendments, cure notices, or other revisions to agreements. Please provide a copy of the executed document as well as any addenda, amendments, attachments, exhibits, materials and schedules.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dillon Bergin

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The database of Suffolk County contracts for the calendar year of 2023, in a machine-readable database or spreadsheet format such as Excel, CSV, Access, SQL or JSON. This database has been provided on Suffolk County's open data portal, but only until the year 2018 (https://opendata.suffolkcountyny.gov/search?collection=dataset&q=County%20Contracts%202018) . 

The data should include all fields in the database or spreadsheets that contain non-exempt information, including but not limited to all fields in the example provided by the Suffolk County Open Data Portal for previous years (https://opendata.suffolkcountyny.gov/datasets/51f3b862baaf40b68028c46da23e7874_0/explore). I also request all documentation that describes the layout of the database’s tables and fields, and that provides the definitions of any field names, codes, and abbreviations used in the database. This information may be gathered together in a single document like a data dictionary, entity layout, or user's guide. If that is the case, I request access to and copy of said document.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dillon Bergin

title: Excited Delirium Training Materials (Rochester Police Department)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all training materials--including manuals and instructor guides--used in the past three years (2021-2024) that mention "excited delirium syndrome" (ExDS).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jenny Wadhwa
